title: 112_hr6497
content: The Act titled "Nevada Mining Townsite Conveyance Act of 2012" allows for the disposal of public lands in mining townsites in Esmeralda and Nye Counties, Nevada. Congress finds that the Federal Government owns real property in historic mining townsites in Esmeralda and Nye Counties, Nevada. Some of this property has been occupied for decades, leading to ownership conflicts and difficulties in management under multiple use policies. The Federal Government owns real property in historic mining townsites in Nevada, leading to ownership conflicts and difficulties in management. Some property is suitable for disposal to promote administrative efficiency, while others contain historic and cultural values that must be protected. Certain parcels should be conveyed to the county for responsible resource management in accordance with land use plans. The term "mining townsite" refers to Federal Government-owned property in Nevada with mining-related improvements. The Secretary of the Interior is authorized to convey these properties without consideration. The United States will convey mining townsites in Nevada to counties, with maps available for public inspection. Recipients may reconvey properties to occupants. Reconveyance of mining townsite properties in Nevada to occupants who can prove a valid interest by occupying the site for at least 15 years before the enactment of the Act. County is not obligated to recognize claims submitted more than 10 years after the Act's enactment. The conveyance of a mining townsite under this section requires the preservation of all historic and cultural resources in accordance with Federal and State law. Valid existing rights, including easements and mining claimants' interests, must be maintained unless deemed abandoned under specific statutes. The Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1993 authorizes the conveyance of mining townsites by the United States, with necessary surveys for legal descriptions. Upon completion of conveyance, the US is released from liability for any claims related to improvements on the property. Appropriations are authorized for the Secretary of the Interior to carry out these conveyances. Funds are allocated for various surveys and clearances needed for conveyances as authorized by the Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1993.
